locsearch.runner package¶

Submodules¶

locsearch.runner.abstract_runner module¶

class locsearch.runner.abstract_runner.AbstractRunner¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Template to create runners.

Runners are responsible for initializing and running an algorithm. I/O and, when needed, plotting data. Implementation can be easily done by inheriting from this class and implementing tha abstract methods. Use instance variables for data that needs to be remembered for use in other methods.

define_algorithm()¶

Creating and initialising an AbstrctLocalSearchObject.

define_evaluation_function()¶

Creating and initialising an evaluation function.

define_move_function()¶

Creating and initialising a move function.

define_solution()¶

Creating and initialising the solution object.

output()¶

Handles the output.

read(path)¶

Reads a file.

Parameters:path (str) – The relative or absolute path to the file.
run(path)¶

initializes and runs an instance of the SteepestDescent class.

Parameters:path (str) – The relative or absolute path to the file.
run_algorithm()¶

Starts running the algorithm.

Returns:The results.
Return type:results

locsearch.runner.steepest_descent_runner module¶

class locsearch.runner.steepest_descent_runner.SteepestDescentRunner¶

Bases: locsearch.runner.abstract_runner.AbstractRunner

Loads a tsp problem and performs a steepestdescent on said problem.

_data¶

The data read from a file.

_distance_matrix¶

The distance matrix for the problem.

Type:numpy.ndarray
_size¶

The amount of points in the tsp problem.

Type:int
_move_function¶

The move function that needs to be used.

Type:AbstractMove
_evaluation_function¶

The evaluation function used for the problem.

Type:AbstractEvaluationFunction
_solution¶

The solution object for the problem.

Type:AbstractLocalSearchSolution
_algorithm¶

The steepest descent algorithm used.

Type:SteepestDescent
results¶

The results from the localsearch.

Examples

Default running:

from locsearch.runner.steepest_descent_runner import SteepestDescentRunner
runner = SteepestDescentRunner()
runner.run()
